TopicTitle: Okay, Squad. Put a "1" down on your kill sheet!

Articles.Content:
Somebody page old man Herbert and his broken dog, because somebody's got some goood neeeeeeews!

Horsham, PA, United States 04/03/2014 8:52 P.M. Departure Scan

So tomorrow the package will come. I will be officing tomorrow, of course, so I still will not be up even that day, but when I get home from office tomorrow, I can spend the night and morning setting her up.

Finally.

Yay! #whackisback

Possibly! Now the only serious concern is whether or not I succeed in the actual construction of said computer. I am doing so sans ESD-bracelet. I do not have one, so I've been doing the ol' radiator tap.

Beards apparently make awesome amounts of static electricity just from general movement.
Lets hope this rig works just as well as the last one . I can't begin to imagine what things you can achieve with so much fuel compacted into 3.75-metre tanks for smaller parts.

Beards apparently make awesome amounts of static electricity just from general movement.

From personal experience...I can confirm.

#whackisback

Ok, usual afternoon update. Memory didn't arrive yet, but I'm not too bummed. Given the tracking number simply states, "Out for delivery." Which means I'll be up late tonight, building, configuring, drooling, building.

Office day today will be brutal from the anticipation of it all

Im a newbie around these parts. But even so, one of the first things I heard about was the fabled Whackjob. Im excited to see what you can do with a new rig, and a new update. Im struggling a little on a duel core @ 1.6GHz, but I think you wont have such problems.
Major update: Parcel confirmed delivered. RAM is waiting at home for me as we speak. Planning on all-nighter to ensure she's up
Fantastic Whackjob! Glad you are going to be back among the Living soon.

#Whackisback(finally!)

Are you gonna get back the extra money you paid for next-day delivery?
